intro: Polypodium propinquum var. laurentii, commonly known as the Laurentian polypody, is a fern native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds that are typically 20–40 cm long. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky outcrops. Its sporangia are clustered in sori on the underside of the fronds, a typical feature of the Polypodiaceae family. This variety is often found growing on tree trunks or in crevices, showcasing its adaptability to various microhabitats.
